featured.text: The reason for doing this was simple: Paperclips were a Norwegian invention whose original function was to bind together.
However, Vaaler’s clips were not the same as the paperclips currently in use.
In the years just prior to 1900, quite a few paperclip designs emerged.

other.text: After the war, a giant paperclip statue was erected in Oslo to 40 Vaaler—even though his design was never actually manufactured.
The name most frequently 34 the paperclip invention is Johan Vaaler, a Norwegian inventor.
Thus, in 39 , they started wearing paperclips to show their solidarity.
Because of Vaaler, the paperclip played an important 37 role in Norway.

definition.zh_def: 一種用來夾住紙張的小型金屬或塑料物品。
definition.en_def: A small metal or plastic device used to hold sheets of paper together.
definition.example: She used a paperclip to keep her documents organized.
